skill.name: dnanexus-integration
skill.description: DNAnexus cloud genomics platform. Build apps/applets, manage data (upload/download), dxpy Python SDK, run workflows, FASTQ/BAM/VCF, for genomics pipeline development and execution.
skill.summary: DNAnexus cloud genomics platform. Build apps/applets, manage data (upload/download), dxpy Python SDK...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown documentation files teaching DNAnexus platform usage. All 454 static findings are false positives triggered by code examples in markdown fenced code blocks. The 'weak cryptographic algorithm' findings refer to MD5 checksums which DNAnexus legitimately uses for file integrity verification in genomics workflows. No executable code exists in this skill.

content.user_title: Build and Deploy DNAnexus Genomics Pipelines
content.value_statement: Managing genomics data and building analysis pipelines on DNAnexus requires learning complex APIs and patterns. This skill provides comprehensive guidance for app development, data management, and workflow execution on the DNAnexus cloud platform.
actual_capabilities: Guides creation of DNAnexus apps and applets using Python or Bash
Explains file upload, download, and data management operations
Documents job execution, monitoring, and workflow orchestration
Provides comprehensive dxpy Python SDK reference and examples
Covers dxapp.json configuration and dependency management
Includes patterns for batch processing and multi-step pipelines
limitations: Requires active DNAnexus account and authentication
Does not execute DNAnexus commands directly
Cannot access or process actual genomics data files
Platform-specific features may change with DNAnexus updates

use_cases.title: Build Custom Analysis Pipeline
use_cases.description: Create DNAnexus apps for variant calling, alignment, or quality control workflows on sequencing data.

use_cases.title: Automate Genomics Data Management
use_cases.description: Write Python scripts using dxpy to upload, organize, and process large-scale genomics datasets systematically.

use_cases.title: Run Batch Analyses on Samples
use_cases.description: Execute parallel analyses across multiple samples and collect results using DNAnexus workflow capabilities.

prompt_templates.title: Create Basic App
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new DNAnexus app project
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a DNAnexus app that takes a FASTQ file as input and runs quality filtering. Show me the dxapp.json and Python entry point.

prompt_templates.title: Upload and Organize Data
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a Python script using dxpy to upload all FASTQ files from a local directory to a DNAnexus project with metadata tags.

prompt_templates.title: Run Parallel Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I launch the same DNAnexus applet on 50 different BAM files in parallel and wait for all jobs to complete?

prompt_templates.title: Configure App Dependencies
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to configure dxapp.json to install samtools, bwa, and custom Python packages as dependencies for my DNAnexus app.

output_examples.input: How do I upload a file to DNAnexus with metadata?
output: Use dxpy.upload_local_file() with project, folder, properties, and tags parameters
Properties are key-value pairs for searchable metadata
Tags are string labels for categorization
File is automatically closed after upload completes

output_examples.input: What is the structure of a DNAnexus app?
output: dxapp.json defines metadata, inputs, outputs, and run specifications
src/ directory contains the main executable script (Python or Bash)
resources/ directory for bundled files and tools

output_examples.input: How do I monitor a running job?
output: Use job.describe() to get current state and progress
Check job.get_state() for status: runnable, running, done, failed
Access logs with dx watch command or job.wait_on_done() in Python
Output references available after job completes successfully

best_practices: Always close data objects after writing to make them available for analysis
Use meaningful folder structures and metadata properties for data organization
Test apps with small datasets before running on full-scale genomics data
anti_patterns: Avoid hardcoding project IDs or file IDs in production scripts
Do not skip error handling when running batch jobs across many samples
Never store API tokens directly in source code or dxapp.json files

faq.question: What is the difference between an app and an applet?
faq.answer: Applets are project-specific executables. Apps are published versions that can be shared across projects and users with version control.

faq.question: How do I authenticate with DNAnexus?
faq.answer: Run 'dx login' for interactive authentication, or set DX_SECURITY_CONTEXT environment variable with your API token for scripts.

faq.question: What file formats does DNAnexus support?
faq.answer: DNAnexus supports any file format. Common genomics formats include FASTQ, BAM, VCF, BED, and GFF. Files are stored as binary data objects.

faq.question: How do I handle large file uploads?
faq.answer: Use dxpy.upload_local_file() which handles chunked uploads automatically. For very large files, consider using the dx upload command with parallelization.

faq.question: Can I use Docker containers in DNAnexus apps?
faq.answer: Yes. Specify a Docker image in dxapp.json runSpec. The platform pulls and runs your container with specified resources and mounted data.

faq.question: How do I pass output from one job to another?
faq.answer: Use job.get_output_ref('output_name') to create a reference that resolves when the job completes. Pass this reference as input to dependent jobs.
